tit.e: Hokenoyama-kofun Tumulus (a keyhole-shaped mound in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture)
Hokenoyama-kofun Tumulus (a keyhole-shaped mound in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: ホケノ山古墳（ほけのやまこふん）は、奈良県桜井市大字箸中字ホケノ山に所在する古墳時代前期初頭の纒向型といわれるホタテ貝型の前方後円墳である。
sen.e: The Hokenoyama Kofun (ancient tomb) is a so-called Makimuku type escallop-shaped zenpokoenfun (large keyhole-shaped tomb) in the early first half of the Kofun period, located in Aza Hokenoyama, Oaza Hashinaka,Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.

The Hokenoyama-kofun Tumulus is a so-called Makimuku type escallop-shaped, large keyhole-shaped mound in the early first half of the Kofun period (Tumulus period), located in Aza Hokenoyama, Oaza Hashinaka, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.

The Hokenoyama-kofun Tumulus is a so-called Makimuku type escallop-shaped, large keyhole-shaped mound in the early first half of the Kofun period (Tumulus period), located in Aza Hokenoyama, Oaza Hashinaka, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 2006年1月26日、国の史跡に指定。
sen.e: On January 26, 2006, it was designated as a national historic site.
On January 26, 2006, it was designated as a national historic site.
On January 26, 2006, it was designated as a national historic site.

sen.j: 現在、復元整備され一般に公開されている。
sen.e: At present restoration and preparation work being over, it is open to the public.
At present restoration and preparation work being over, it is open to the public.
At present restoration and preparation work being over, it is open to the public.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 所在地：三輪山の西山麓、箸墓古墳の東側
sen.e: Location: At the west foot of Mt. Miwa, in the east of the Hashihaka Kofun
Location: At the west foot of Mt. Miwa, in the east of the Hashihaka-kofun Tumulus
Location: At the west foot of Mt. Miwa, in the east of the Hashihaka-kofun Tumulus

sen.j: 被葬者：不明（大神神社は豊鍬入姫命の墓としている）
sen.e: Buried person: Unknown (Omiwa Shrine takes it as a Toyosukiribirinomikoto's tomb).
Buried person: Unknown (Omiwa-jinja Shrine takes it as Toyosuki iribime no mikoto's tomb).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: Buried person: Unknown (Omiwa-jinja Shrine takes it as Toyosuki iribime no mikoto's tomb).

sen.j: 築造時期：副葬品や埋葬施設などから箸墓古墳に代表される定型化した出現期大型前方後円墳よりあまり遡らない時期の前方後円墳と考えられ、邪馬台国時代に築造されたと推測されている。
sen.e: Time of construction: It is thought, judging from grave goods and burial facilities, to be a zenpokoenfun (large keyhole-shaped tomb) in the period dating back some years to the period in which stylized large zenpokoenfuns typified by the Hashihaka Kofun appeared, and therefore it is presumed to have been built in the Yamataikoku period.

Time of construction: Judging from grave goods and burial facilities, it is thought to be a large keyhole-shaped mound in the period dating back some years to the period in which stylized large keyhole-shaped mounds typified by the Hashihaka-kofun Tumulus appeared, and therefore it is presumed to have been built in the era of Yamatai-Koku kingdom.

Time of construction: Judging from grave goods and burial facilities, it is thought to be a large keyhole-shaped mound in the period dating back some years to the period in which stylized large keyhole-shaped mounds typified by the Hashihaka-kofun Tumulus appeared, and therefore it is presumed to have been built in the era of Yamatai-Koku kingdom.

sen.j: 前方後円形をした弥生憤丘墓であるとする見方と古墳時代のものであるとする見方が出されている。
sen.e: There are two views about the tomb; one is that it is a zenpokoenfun style Yayoi mound tomb, and the other a tomb in the Kofun period.
There are two views about the tomb; one is that it is a keyhole-shaped Yayoi mound tomb and the other a tomb in the Kofun period.
There are two views about the tomb; one is that it is a keyhole-shaped Yayoi mound tomb and the other a tomb in the Kofun period.

sen.j: 墳 形：纒向型前方後円墳（葺石あり）、円墳に短い前方部を付けている。
sen.e: Tomb shape: A Makimuku type zenpokoenfun (some fukiishi or a layer of stone covering the soil over a burial mound found), with a short front part attached to the circular part.
Tomb shape: A Makimuku type keyhole-shaped mound (some fukiishi [a layer of stone covering the soil over a burial mound] found), with a short front square part attached to the circular part.
Tomb shape: A Makimuku type keyhole-shaped mound (some fukiishi [a layer of stone covering the soil over a burial mound] found), with a short front square part attached to the circular part.

sen.j: 規 模：全長約80メートル、後円部径約55メートル、後円部三段築成、周濠幅約10.5～17.5メートル
sen.e: Size: It is 80m in full length, with the three tiered back circular part about 55m in diameter, and with a shugo (loop moat) 10.5 to 17.5m in width

Size: It is approximately 80 meters in full length, with the three tiered back circular part approximately 55 meters in diameter, and with a shugo (surrounding moat) approximately 10.5 to 17.5 meters in width.

Size: It is approximately 80 meters in full length, with the three tiered back circular part approximately 55 meters in diameter, and with a shugo (surrounding moat) approximately 10.5 to 17.5 meters in width.

sen.j: 発掘調査1999年9月から奈良県立橿原考古学研究所と桜井市教育委員会によって実施された。
sen.e: Excavation investigation was started by the Kashihara Archaeological Institute, Nara Prefecture and the Sakurai City Board of Education from September, 1999.
Excavation investigation: Started by the Kashihara Archaeological Institute, Nara Prefecture and the Sakurai City Board of Education from September, 1999.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: Excavation investigation: Started by the Kashihara Archaeological Institute, Nara Prefecture and the Sakurai City Board of Education from September, 1999.

sen.j: 位置
sen.e: Location
Location
Location

sen.j: 埋葬施設
sen.e: Burial facilities
Burial facilities
Burial facilities

sen.j: 墳頂部の中央から「石囲い木槨」出土。
sen.e: A "stone-fenced mokkaku (wooden burial chamber) " was found in the central part of the tomb surface
A 'stone-fenced mokkaku' (wooden burial chamber) was found in the center top of the tomb.
A 'stone-fenced mokkaku' (wooden burial chamber) was found in the center top of the tomb.

sen.j: 大きな土壙内に内側の長さ約7メートル、幅約2.7メートル石室状の施設。
sen.e: In the inside of a large doko (dug-out hole) there was a stone chamber-like facility about 7m in length and about 2.7m in width.
In the inside of a large doko (dug-out hole) there was a stone chamber-like facility approximately 7 meters in length and approximately 2.7 meters in width.
In the inside of a large doko (dug-out hole) there was a stone chamber-like facility approximately 7 meters in length and approximately 2.7 meters in width.

sen.j: その内部にコウヤマキ製の5メートルの刳り抜き式木棺を納めた大規模な木槨。
sen.e: In its inside there was a large size mokkoku) in which five meter hollowed-out coffin made of Japanese umbrella pine was placed.
There was a large size mokkaku in which 5 meters hollowed-out coffin made of Japanese umbrella pine was placed inside it.
sen.cmt: 他と合わせてアラビア数字にし、余分な記号などを削除、読み修正しました。
sen.e: There was a large size mokkaku in which 5 meters hollowed-out coffin made of Japanese umbrella pine was placed inside it.

sen.j: 広義の割竹形木槨。
sen.e: Split bamboo-shape mokkoku in a broad sense
Split bamboo-shape mokkaku in a broad sense.
sen.cmt: 読み修正、ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: Split bamboo-shape mokkaku in a broad sense.

sen.j: 天井は木材を渡し、その上に地元の川原石を積んでいる。
sen.e: The ceiling was made of lumber, on which local riverbed stones were piled up.
The ceiling was made of lumber, on which local riverbed stones were piled up.
The ceiling was made of lumber, on which local riverbed stones were piled up.

sen.j: 水銀朱で覆われていたと思われる。
sen.e: It seems to have been covered with cinnabar mercury.
It seems to have been covered with cinnabar mercury.
It seems to have been covered with cinnabar mercury.

sen.j: 前方部裾葺石の一部除去し木棺を埋葬。
sen.e: A part of hem fukiishi (a layer of stone covering the soil over a burial mound) in the front part was removed and a wooden coffin was buried.
A part of hem fukiishi in the front square part was removed and a wooden coffin was buried.
sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除し、用語を変えました。
sen.e: A part of hem fukiishi in the front square part was removed and a wooden coffin was buried.

sen.j: くびれ部に簡単な埋葬施設一基。
sen.e: One simple burial facility in the constricted spot.
One simple burial facility in the constricted spot.
One simple burial facility in the constricted spot.

sen.j: 横穴式石室（主体部の西側に6世紀末頃墳丘を利用し埋葬）
sen.e: A corridor-style stone chamber (around the end of 6th century on the west side of the main body the burial was done using the mound)
A corridor-style stone chamber (around the end of sixth century on the west side of the main body the burial was done using the mound)
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。
sen.e: A corridor-style stone chamber (around the end of sixth century on the west side of the main body the burial was done using the mound)

sen.j: 石室全長14m以上
sen.e: The stone chamber is more than 14 meters in full length
The stone chamber is more than 14 meters in full length.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: The stone chamber is more than 14 meters in full length.

sen.j: 玄室に組合式家形石棺
sen.e: In the burial chamber there is a sectional house-shaped stone chamber
In the burial chamber there is a sectional house-shaped stone chamber.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: In the burial chamber there is a sectional house-shaped stone chamber.

sen.j: 大型壺（瀬戸内系、高さ77cm・最大径65cm）
sen.e: Large size jars (Setouchi type, 77cm in height/ 65cm in maximum diameter)
Large size jars (Setouchi type, 77 centimeters in height, 65 centimeters in maximum diameter)
Large size jars (Setouchi type, 77 centimeters in height, 65 centimeters in maximum diameter)

sen.j: 中型壺（東海系、高さ26cm・最大径24cm）
sen.e: Middle size jars (Tokai style, 26cm in height/24cm in maximum diameter)
Middle size jars (Tokai style, 26 centimeters in height, 24 centimeters in maximum diameter)
Middle size jars (Tokai style, 26 centimeters in height, 24 centimeters in maximum diameter)

sen.j: 鋼鏃×約60本
sen.e: Copper arrowhead (1) x about 60
Approximately 60 copper arrowheads
Approximately 60 copper arrowheads

sen.j: 鉄鏃×約60本
sen.e: Copper arrowhead (1) x about 60
Approximately 60 iron arrowheads
Approximately 60 iron arrowheads

sen.j: 素環頭大刀1口
sen.e: Sokanto sword (1)
One sokantotachi (an iron sword with a ring pommel)
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: One sokantotachi (an iron sword with a ring pommel)

sen.j: 鉄製刀剣類10口
sen.e: Iron swords (10)
10 iron swords
10 iron swords

sen.j: 加飾壷
sen.e: Decorated jars
Decorated jars
Decorated jars

sen.j: 画紋帯同向式神獣鏡（がもんたいどうこうしきしんじゅうきょう）一面
sen.e: Gamontaidoukoshikishinju mirror (1)
Gamontai Dokoshiki Shinju-kyo Mirror (Mirror with figures of deities and sacred animals which all the images face in the same direction)
Gamontai Dokoshiki Shinju-kyo Mirror (Mirror with figures of deities and sacred animals which all the images face in the same direction)

sen.j: 画紋帯神獣鏡かと考えられる銅鏡片二個体分、内行花文鏡片
sen.e: Fragments of copper mirrors which are supposed to be gamontaishinju mirrors (for 2 mirrors), fragments of naikokamon mirrors
Fragments of possibly two Gamontai Shinju-kyo Mirrors (Mirror with figures of deities and sacred animals), fragments of Naiko Kamon-kyo Mirror (Mirror with patterns like a flower-petal)
sen.cmt: 用語を変え、補足しました。
sen.e: Fragments of possibly two Gamontai Shinju-kyo Mirrors (Mirror with figures of deities and sacred animals), fragments of Naiko Kamon-kyo Mirror (Mirror with patterns like a flower-petal)

sen.j: 鉄製農工具
sen.e: Iron farming tools
Iron farming tools
Iron farming tools

sen.j: 二重口縁壺20体（庄内式）
sen.e: (Shonai-type) nijuguchien jars (20)
20 Niju Koen tsubo (double rim pot) (Shonai-type)
sen.cmt: 用語を変え、補足しました。
